reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled around the States and this was the best hotel we stayed in. Rooms large and comfortable with all you need. Free cooked breakfast excellent with fresh fruit, juice,cooked eggs, toast, cereals and cakes to name a few things available. Water in fridge and coffee etc in rooms. Did not get to go to pool but looked nice. All our group were very happy with the rooms and comfort here.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Spent three nights at Country Inn and Suites on our way up to Canada. The hotel has a wonderful warm feeling to it and the decor is somewhat country style adding to the charm. All staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. The rooms are spacious and the only complaint we had is that the beds were very soft, being used to a harder bed it took a bit of getting used to. The complimentary buffet is ample and tasty. Coffee and tea is provided free of charge 24 hours a day. The hotel has a great selection of DVD's to choose from and a DVD player is in every room. If you borrow a film the staff give you a bag of microwave popcorn free - nice touch.
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also ave a wonderful library of books to choose from and you can take the book with you and return to any other Country Inn within the US and Canada - another great touch.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: There is a nice pool and jacuzzi and a great laundry room for guests to use. Within a short walking distance to the hotel is the Country Store, a superb gift and craft store with an on site bakery and restaurant. It's well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: We have booked to stay at the Country Inn and Suites in Niagara Falls so we hope the whole chain is as good as this hotel in Lewisburg!
reviews.title: not as new as I'd hoped

reviews.text: We stayed here while visiting Bucknell. Excellent value for our money. Clean room & courteous staff. Continental Breakfast was pretty good too. Extra pillows on bed & flat screen tv. A short 4-5 minute drive to the university.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: We usually stay at this hotel at least 3 or 4 times a year. I booked a smoking suite on April 15 or 15th for April 18th, 2013. We LOVE this hotel--when we went to check in we were told that ALL the rooms were non-smoking now.. even tho our reservation said smoking right on it.. The woman at the desk made arrangements to go to Best western Plus just across the street. They treated us Wonderfully and will be booking there from now on until they discontinue smoking rooms and Suites in November.. Just don't understand--all the smoking rooms are always filled--yet they get rid of them!! I guess it's true--us smokers have NO rights anymore!! i'm on Vacation and I can't smoke in my room that I pay good money for!! Not right..
reviews.title: upset...
Comfortable Stay
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent three nights at this property and could not have been more pleased. Hotel staff was courteous, kind, and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. I especially liked having a guest laundry with full size machines. The exercise room went above and beyond the usual treadmill and elliptical to include free weights, an exercise ball, and Pilates mat. Convenient location + quality = return visit.

This was our second stay at this chain and the first at this particular hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean with more conveniences than your typical hotel room. We appreciated the separate sitting area with tv, and the fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Your stay comes with a hot breakfast and lots of other breakfast choices. They go the extra mile to make you feel at home including book and DVD lending libraries, and games you can borrow, too. They even have free bags of ice for guests who need to fill up a cooler. There was a nice pool and fitness center and the entire property was pristine. The staff member at the front desk was also very efficient and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great place to stay when visiting Bucknell
Comfortable and clean
reviews.text: This was our second stay here while visiting Bucknell University. The rooms are immaculate, the beds very comfortable and there was plenty of space (we had a king suite). Front desk staff was efficient and the breakfast was adequate. The location is convenient to everything in the area. We would stay here again.

This hotel repeatedly goes above & beyond for their guests. I have had circumstances arise twice now were I needed a place to stay late at night with little or no warning & this hotel has reached out & helped me on both occassions & always with a smile. The service is outstanding, the rooms & common areas VERY clean & the prices, outstanding! Love the homemade cookies that are always available at the front desk & the full complimentary breakfasts are like nothing I've ever encountered in any hotel before. The variety & quality of food is incredible. Bid kudos go out to this hotel's staff. Thank you for saving me yet again!
reviews.title: Always an amazing experience

reviews.text: Location is excellent--close to hospital, university, shopping, restaurants. Room was clean and comfortable. Front desk was not well staffed when I was there and it took time to get someone for check in and for answering calls--but staff was polite and helpful once there.
reviews.title: good location, comfortable room

reviews.text: Free upgrade was a nice gesture. However, the radiator in the bedroom was so loud that I could hardly sleep all night, even with earplugs in both ears. Also, the "full breakfast" in the morning was at best continental and in reality uneatable for us. Upon making a reservation we were debating whether to stay at this place or best western across the street which was $30 cheaper. We were assured by the reservations desk there would be "full hot breakfast" in the morning. Well, there was not. There was barely anything to eat. Sorry, not such a great stay for us.
reviews.title: so so

reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the Country Inn and Suites. Can't say anything negative about it! It's not luxurious, but has everything you want. The staff members are polite and helpful. The bed was great. Breakfast was fine. I appreciated the cookies at the front desk. My first choice hotel when staying in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed at this property recently with family for Knoebels Halloween Weekend. We chose this hotel based on a positive stay at a previous Country Inn that we stayed at. Hotel is a bit further away then the other hotels, but defninitely worth the drive. The kids loved the pool and the breakfast each day. Rooms are fairly spacious and clean. Very nice to sit outside in the country air. Definitely a nice break from city life! We will definitely stay at this property the next time we are visiting the area.
reviews.title: Great Knoebels weekend

reviews.text: The hotel is relatively new so the rooms are well designed and spacious. This would have been a 4 except for three things. The internet is EXTREMELY SLOOOW. I asked for a 7am wake up call, that didn't come until 7:30. I asked for polyester pillows when I arrived but it took a couple of hours due to limited staff. Also, one of the desk staff argued with me that the pillows in the room were polyester. I said the labels on the pillows said down.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel recently and were impressed by how well-managed it is. The staff was extremely eager to make our visit enjoyable, and they succeeded. It was very clean and the breakfast was great.
reviews.title: A really good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this location for one night with a Bus Tour that was leading in October! We have stayed at this particular location at least 5 to 6 times in the past and always have an excellent stay! Had many excellent comments from our tour group! This hotel is always very clean and they will change from feather bedding to non feather for our allergies! The people on the tour mentioned what they liked was in the breakfast dining room they use real dishes and cutlery not plastic and styrofoam! This was noted as the next hotel we stayed at did use disposable dishes and cutlery! I would highly recommend Country Inn and Suites, Lewisburg, PA or any Country Inns for that matter when looking for a good hotel!! Thank you Lewisburg, PA for hosting our group and giving us a good experience once again!! Have given your location to several of my friends!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been there many times during the past three years since my daughter started Susquehanna University. The hotel is staffed with a wonderful front dest employee named Monica. She is very helpful and assists your every need. The breakfast in the morning is delicious and all you can eat. They also have an indoor pool and hot tub.This is the place to stay if visiting the Bucknell/Susquehanna area.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here overnight on the way to and from NYC. Very friendly, clean, and comfortable. Also considerably more affordable than lodging at nearby College Station. Won't hesitate to book here again if were in the area again overnight.
reviews.title: This Place is a Winner!
